messages.message: Ideally, we’d frame this out as “we know we perform better than your internal team, we’ve shown that using metrics that are easy to understand. We’re not here to force anyone to use Instabase, so if they opt to use their own solution, that’s fine.”

if the CDMS team isn’t responsible for all of Instabase at the bank, and are just mad that Instabase is there, we can work around that without kicking them off the platform; but we may need to ask SC to figure out why they’re wasting all this time building comparisons when they can just use their own homebrewed thing
Ultimately, this may require heading out there and getting in a room with everyone to figure out what the real source of this is
Is there a way for SC to plug the CDMS teams wonder-OCR into Instabase?

if we can reframe as them having the opportunity to use the work they’ve done to make instabase more useful for everyone at SC, that might be an approach to consider (although there are some risks here too if they think they’re doing the work we should be doing)

There is such a thing has having a bad customer and “disinviting” them from being your customer, but I don’t know if I’ve seen a single team get kicked off a platform before, especially on the enterprise side
